_header: Man among thy mirths have in mind
_description: The XVI Points of Charity — fourteen 8-line stanzas

CULIi639.First Lines:
Man amongthi mirþe þis haue in myndeWhennes þu cam
                    & weder þu tendis…
CULIi639.Last Lines:
…I ham not worþ to gon as longeas me want par
                        charite
CULIi639.Note:
Three stanzas only, added to originally blank space at end of a text
                        ‘hugo de consciencia’.

Lam853.First Lines:
MAn among þi myrþis haue in myndeffrom whens þou
                    come & whidir þou teendisHow freelli þou fallist & filist
                    þi kindeArise & make of þi mys
                    ameendis…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…God þat hast us oure lijf lentGraunte þat we may
                    oure silf to enserche & seAs þou for us on roode were
                    rentÞou chese us to þe for charite AMEN
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 114-17.
